alert.note: Alert for Marion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 5:16PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN MARION COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM CDT... At 516 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jasper, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, South Pittsburg, Kimball, Orme, Sequatchie Cave, Haletown (guild), New Hope, and Hicks Gap State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
